intro: Matelea mexicana, commonly known as Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. The plant is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
